Conversation¶

class cpaassdk.resources.conversation.Conversation(api)¶

CPaaS conversation.

create_message(params)¶

Send a new outbound message

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options.

  • params['sender_address'] (str) – Sender address information, basically the from address. E164 formatted DID number passed as a value, which is owned by the user. If the user wants to let CPaaS uses the default assigned DID number, this field can either has “default” value or the same value as the user_id.

  • params['destination_address'] (array[str]) –

  • params['message'] (str) – SMS text message

get_messages(params)¶

Gets all messages.

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['remote_address'] (str) – Remote address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the destination telephone number that user exchanged SMS before. E164 formatted DID number passed as a value.

  • params['local_address'] (str) – Local address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the source telephone number that user exchanged SMS before.

  • params['query'] (dict, optional) – To hold all query related parameters.

  • params['query']['name'] (int, optional) – Performs search operation on first_name and last_name fields.

  • params['query']['first_name'] (int, optional) – Performs search for the first_name field of the directory items.

  • params['query']['last_name'] (int, optional) – Performs search for the last_name field of the directory items.

  • params['query']['user_name'] (int, optional) – Performs search for the user_name field of the directory items.

  • params['query']['phone_number'] (int, optional) – Performs search for the fields containing a phone number, like businessPhoneNumber, homePhoneNumber, mobile, pager, fax.

  • params['query']['order'] (int, optional) – Ordering the contact results based on the requested sortBy value, order query parameter should be accompanied by sortBy query parameter.

  • params['query']['sort_by'] (int, optional) – SortBy value is used to detect sorting the contact results based on which attribute. If order is not provided with that, ascending order is used.

  • params['query']['max'] (int, optional) – Maximum number of contact results that has been requested from CPaaS for this query.

  • params['query']['next'] (string, optional) – Pointer for the next chunk of contacts, should be gathered from the previous query results.

get_status(params)¶

Read a conversation message status

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • ( (params['type']) – obj: str): Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['remote_address'] (str) – Remote address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the destination telephone number that user exchanged SMS before. E164 formatted DID number passed as a value.

  • params['local_address'] (str) – Local address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the source telephone number that user exchanged SMS before.

  • params['message_id'] (str) – Identification of the SMS message.

get_messages_in_thread(params)¶

Read all messages in a thread

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['local_address'] (str) – Local address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the source telephone number that user exchanged SMS before.

  • params['remote_address'] (str) – Remote address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the destination telephone number that user exchanged SMS before. E164 formatted DID number passed as a value.

  • params['query'] (dict, optional) – To hold all query related parameters.

  • params['query']['max'] (int, optional) – Number of messages that is requested from CPaaS.

  • params['query']['next'] (string, optional) – Pointer for the next page to retrieve for the messages, provided by CPaaS in previous GET response.

  • params['query']['new'] (string, optional) – Filters the messages or threads having messages that are not received by the user yet

  • params['query']['last_message_time'] (int, optional) – Filters the messages or threads having messages that are sent/received after provided Epoch time

delete_message(params)¶

Delete conversation message

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['remote_address'] (str) – Remote address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the destination telephone number that user exchanged SMS before. E164 formatted DID number passed as a value.

  • params['local_address'] (str) – Local address information while retrieving the SMS history, basically the source telephone number that user exchanged SMS before.

  • params['message_id'] (str, optional) – Identification of the SMS message. If messageId is not passed then the SMS thread is deleted with all messages.

get_subscriptions(params)¶

Read all active subscriptions.

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

get_subscription(params)¶

Read active subscription

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['subscription_id'] (str) – Resource ID of the subscription

subscribe(params)¶

Create a new subscription.

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['webhook_url'] (str) – The webhook that has been acquired during SMS API subscription, which the incoming notifications supposed to be sent to.

  • params['destination_address'] (str, optional) – The address that incoming messages are received for this subscription. If does not exist, CPaaS uses the default assigned DID number to subscribe against. It is suggested to provide the intended E164 formatted DID number within this parameter.

unsubscribe(params)¶

Unsubscription from conversation notification

Parameters

  • params (dict) – Single parameter to hold all options

  • params['type'] (str) – Type of conversation. Possible values - SMS. Check conversation.types for more options

  • params['subscription_id'] (str) – Resource ID of the subscription
